Welcome to Bag of Words’s documentation!¶

Some section¶

Hello world!

class bagofwords.ReviewPreprocessor¶

ReviewPreprocessor is an utility class for processing raw HTML text into segments for further learning.

static review2sentences(review: str, remove_stopwords: bool = False) → typing.Iterable[typing.List[str]]¶

Given a review, splits it into sentences where each sentence is a list of words.

Parameters:
  • review (str) – The review as raw HTML.
  • remove_stopwords (bool) – Whether to remove the stopwords.
Returns:

Review split into sentences.
Return type:

Iterable[List[str]]
static review2wordlist(review: str, remove_stopwords: bool = False) → typing.List[str]¶

Given a review, parses it as HTML, removes all URLs and non-alphabetical characters, and optionally removes the stopwords. The review is then split into lowercase words and the resulting list is returned.

Parameters:
  • review (str) – The review as raw HTML.
  • remove_stopwords (bool) – Whether to remove the stopwords.
Returns:

Review split into words.
Return type:

List[str]
bagofwords.clean_up_reviews(reviews: typing.Iterable[str], remove_stopwords: bool = True, clean_file: typing.Union[str, NoneType] = None) → numpy.ndarray¶

Given an list of reviews, either loads pre-computed clean reviews from clean_file or applies ReviewPreprocessor.review2wordlist() to each review and converts it into an numpy.ndarray. Also, if clean_file is not None clean reviews are saved to it.

Parameters:
  • reviews (Iterable[str]) – Reviews to clean up.
  • remove_stopwords (bool) – Whether to remove the stopwords.
  • clean_file (Optional[str]) – File where clean reviews are stored.
Returns:

Iterable of clean reviews.
Return type:

Iterable[str]
